newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: CRICKET-NEW ZEALAND BAT FIRST AGAINST SRI LANKA.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-NEW ZEALAND BAT FIRST AGAINST SRI LANKA.

text.p: New Zealand won the toss and chose to bat first in the second test against Sri Lanka on Friday.
The New Zealand team was unchanged from the one which won the first test in Dunedin by an innings and 36 runs.
Sri Lanka made two changes. Specialist batsman Marvan Atapattu was dropped in favour of off spinner Kumar Dharmasena while left-arm seam bowler Sajeewa de Silva replaced Pramodya Wickremasinghe.
New Zealand - Stephen Fleming (captain), Blair Pocock, Bryan Young, Matt Horne, Nathan Astle, Chris Cairns, Adam Parore, Dipak Patel, Daniel Vettori, Simon Doull, Heath Davis.

Sri Lanka - Arjuna Ranatunga (captain), Sanath Jayasuriya, Roshan Mahanama, Aravinda de Silva, Hashan Tillekaratne, Romesh Kaluwitharana, Chaminda Vaas, Nuwan Zoysa, Muttiah Muralitharan, Kumar Dharmasena, Sajeewa de Silva.
